reviewText: The concept was good the animation, I don't know exactly what to say. Overall I enjoyed the short cartoon story.
My children and I thoroughly enjoyed watching this short film. We found ourselves walking around singing/humming the songs. While I wish it were longer, I'm happy that Disney animated the story.
Should be banned from the store. Misleading 4 minute video for $3.

"John Henry" is one of Rabbit Ears finest classics since "Pecos Bill" as it details the adventures of America's greatest African American hero going up against the steam drill. Denzel Washington's narration is energetic and proud as he narrates John Henry's adventures as if he was really there ( which he points out somewhere in the beginning of the story). B.B. King's music is probably the best part since it is jazzy and soulful, which brings life to this story. Barry Jackson's illustrations are colorful and beautiful, especially of the image of John Henry wearing a white t-shirt and blue jeans. This Rabbit Ears classic will certainly be a favorite for both children and adults.  Also, I would strongly recommend you watch the other Rabbit Ears classics such as "The Fool and the Flying Ship" my personal favorite, "Pecos Bill," "Princess Scargo and the Birthday Pumpkin," and "The Emperor and the Nightingale."

I am a recent convert to "Rabbit Ears" videos...none have appeared on DVD to date, so these are buried treasures. Most of the animated folk tales are very well done.  The story of John Henry (the boy who was born with a hammer in his hand) is recited in a folksy manner by Denzel Washington...but the music of B.B. King takes this simple film over the top.  If you find this VHS interesting,  take a look at the "Emperor and the Nightingale" - my personal favorite -  or "How the Leopard Got His Spots" - all by Rabbit Ears.  I have been showing these childrens'
movies to discriminating adults and all have very positive things to say...about the artwork, the content, and last but not least, the outstanding actors who have lent their voices to this series.

I read John Henry: An American Legend (Ezra Jack Keats) to my boys when they were 3 and 5  then found this video - they are now 5 and 7 and still can't get enough of either!  Super narration and music - great action through storytelling!

I am now buying a copy for my son's Second Grade classroom teacher!
Great tunes!
Artistically excellent and a treat for my Five year old daughter.
Great animated short of a famous American Tall Tale.
Grandkids loved it.
Great music. My 3 year old loves this folktale.
Our family truly enjoyed this folktale.
great short artistic film about john Henry.  A little emotional at the end, but my kids love it.

My toddler absolutely loves this little short from Disney. It's got great songs and the animation is all very bright and colorful. We purchased it for her to watch on her kindle for long car rides and she plays it at least twice a trip. My husband and I really like the animation and the fact that you can see that it's hand drawn!
Well told story with great animation.
image is clean and I love it overall
I loved this short film. I had my daughter watch it to follow up on a book she was reading about folk tales.

Excellent story - based on a real dude.  Everyone should watch this - its inspirational.
